quest.name: Dragon Sound
journal: Orn Khai is in very low spirits.

Upon approaching Orn Khai it becomes obvious that he is quite down in the dumps. He laments that he has little to show for all his years, and has been unable to uncover the source of Faunehm's rage. However, as luck would have it, it is Orn Khai's despair that allows him to see the truth─Faunehm's current state is a result of having to bear centuries of solitude. Just as he happens upon this theory, the warrior you previously met informs you that some Qestiri merchants have hired a dragon hunter. You hurry with Orn Khai to get to Faunehm before the hunter can.

As you search frantically for Faunehm, you are approached by none other than Estinien, the dragon hunter tasked with slaying Faunehm. He explains how he came to find himself in the area and agrees to lend you his aid upon hearing of your quest to reunite Orn Khai's father with his consort.

The three of you do battle with Faunehm, Orn Khai trying in vain to clear the haze that shrouds her mind, but he does succeed in alerting his father to their presence. Vedrfolnir is able to return his consort to her former self, allowing the battle to reach a peaceful conclusion.

After a millennium apart, Faunehm and Vedrfolnir are reunited at last and free once again to soar the skies above Dravania. You bid farewell to the former Azure Dragoon and your dragon ally, dreaming of future adventures.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “Courage Born of Fear.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “Heavens Weep.”

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, nice to see you again... Pray forgive me, I have not made any progress in ascertaining the reason for Faunehm's rage.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: It is truly pathetic... I have been alive far, far longer than you and yet have nothing to show for it.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Surely you did not think me younger than you?

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I may be small, but you should know that we Dravanians live far longer than any man!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Wait. We do live an awfully long time─Forename, I think I may have got it!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Dravanians live for eons; I have heard tales from Gullinbursti of dragons going into seclusion for centuries while carrying grief in their hearts. Ultimately, they are unable to bear the strain and it breaks something fundamental within them.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Many a year will need to pass before I come of age to choose a consort, but I believe they help in saving oneself from the abyss of isolation. This is why your kind elects to marry, is it not?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We marry for love.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We marry to save our race from extinction.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I have no idea why anyone marries.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Love? That sounds fairly similar to our reason for choosing a consort.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Wait, do you mean to say you require two of your race to mate!? It is a wonder you have not gone extinct considering the brevity of your lives. It is so much simpler for dragons─only one of us is required to lay our eggs!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Truly? I had considered you more worldly than that, but it seems I was wrong.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Regardless, I am almost certain that Faunehm's fury was caused by the profound loneliness she has endured over this past millennium. Leaving Father's side after they spent so long together must have caused her intense anguish. The question is, how do we heal her pain?

dialogue.name: ORONIRWARRIOR
dialogue.text: I see you two survived your talk with the dragon. Was it as fruitful a discussion as you had hoped for?

dialogue.name: ORONIRWARRIOR
dialogue.text: Not that it matters much. A group of Qestiri merchants have pooled their resources and hired a hunter said to be quite handy with a lance. I've my doubts he's capable of slaying the wyrm, but that doesn't mean I'm not going to watch him try.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I wonder who the dragonslayer in question could be. I struggle to imagine there are that many men with the skill to go toe-to-toe with a dragon like Faunehm...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: However, if he is truly a threat, then we cannot risk him reaching her before us. We may not have a plan, but we have little choice. Come, Forename, let us hurry to where we last saw Faunehm!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Wh-Where is she? We must find her before that hunter does!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: (-???-)'Tis good to see you again, Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It would seem that we two Azure Dragoons share one target. Though I suppose neither of us still hold that mantle─old habits do not die so easily.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: The Azure Dragoon of Ishgard!?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: And who exactly is your diminutive friend, Forename?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: A journey to the Far East in search of an ancient wyrm's consort? Quite a tale indeed.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: At the end of my own journey, I chose to continue my travels and eventually found myself in the Far East. It was here that word of the dragon you seek reached mine ears.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: After seeing the future of the Holy See placed in Ser Aymeric's capable hands, I chose to embark upon my own journey. One that would allow me to rediscover my purpose, now that Ishgard no longer has need of an Azure Dragoon. It was during my travels that I came to learn of the dragon you seek.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It had been my intention to act as an intermediary between man and dragon, assuming the beast could be reasoned with. If not, I was prepared to brandish my lance.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Regardless, I would wager that the young one has the right of it. What is more, she is doubtless still suffering from the effects of Nidhogg's hateful dirge that summoned the Horde.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The dread wyrm's hold over his brood was absolute. His unquenchable thirst for vengeance spread through the Horde, leaving none untouched. To think one of them was able to resist his call to decimate Ishgard...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It should come as no surprise that she would succumb to madness; the wyrm spent a millennium in solitude resisting Nidhogg's demands for vengeance.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I can think of but one way she may be saved: we weaken her enough that she is willing to listen to reason.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: We have already tried that approach! It did not work last time and I very much doubt repeating it will change anything.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I do not advocate the same approach, little one. I would have you do more than simply talk to her, nay, you shall use your roar. That is the only way you can hope to let her know the war is ended, that her consort awaits her in the skies above.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: My roar?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: You have the two dragoons that bested Nidhogg at your side─there is naught to fear. All you need do is harness your roar to clear the haze that clouds the wyrm's eyes.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I-I shall do my best. Should we fail again, I fear we may not be blessed with another chance. Pray lend me your strength, Azure Dragoons.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Let us depart. The frenzied dragon awaits us on Bardam's Mettle─the time is nigh to free her from war's tragedy!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: With me!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Now, little one! Roar with all your being!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Faunehm, hear my cry!

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Why? Why must we go to war...? I have no ill will, no desire to fight...

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: I have...only silence... A most deafening silence...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: It is no use! I cannot reach her!

dialogue.name: VEDRFOLNIR
dialogue.text: Do not be so quick to abandon hope, my son!

dialogue.name: VEDRFOLNIR
dialogue.text: I am come for thee, dearest Faunehm.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Those wings of white... Long have they filled my dreams... Vedrfolnir, my love...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Father...

dialogue.name: VEDRFOLNIR
dialogue.text: Noble dragoons, Orn Khai. I give you my thanks. Were it not for your succor, I would not have been reunited with my beloved.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Allow me to thank you as well. I had truly thought Vedrfolnir lost to me. Mere words will scarce be enough to convey mine appreciation.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: When the conflict began one thousand years past, Nidhogg demanded we exact vengeance upon man.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: However, I refused to allow his hatred to take root within me. I could not bring myself to forget the days when I soared the azure skies with Vedrfolnir, knight on back.

dialogue.name: VEDRFOLNIR
dialogue.text: A dragon cannot simply shut her ears to her sire's call; to do so would cause her great torment. Thus I bid Faunehm flee to the east, that she might live in peace until the final strains of the Dragonsong War did fade to an end.

dialogue.name: VEDRFOLNIR
dialogue.text: Duty-bound to protect Zenith, I remained behind in Dravania. But ever did I regret not following my heart─and my beloved. 'Twas after she left for eastern lands that thou didst come into this world, my son.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Now I finally see why I was given a name meaning “one born of sadness.”

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Alas, I fear I will never be your match, Father. Faunehm barely even noticed my roar...

dialogue.name: VEDRFOLNIR
dialogue.text: Belittle not your efforts, Orn Khai. I should not have known to come here were it not for thy roar. It reached mine ears, strong and clear, as I soared the skies above.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Father...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Ahem. Well, I suppose you are quite keen to talk with Faunehm. It's been quite some time since you last met, after all.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: L-Let us make haste. I am not used to seeing my father so enamored...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Not quite what I expected when I took on this job, I must admit. But it has been quite something to see what the young dragon is capable of.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I give both of you my sincerest thanks. I find myself especially indebted to you, Forename. Our adventures investigating these legends shall live long in my memory.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: And you, Azure Dragoon. Your strength far exceeds the tales I have heard.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Your words are appreciated, but the appellation is unnecessary. I have long since left that life behind.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: My past experiences with Nidhogg made me eager to see Faunehm saved.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: When the dread wyrm took me as his...vessel, I felt his mad heart's palpitations as mine own. There was no end to the sadness and distress that flowed from his soul. However, it was this ordeal that allowed me to harness the dragon within, whilst retaining my sense of self.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: You ought to be capable of the same by now, Forename. It shall doubtless serve you well in battles to come.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: If you are truly done with your old title, then I have a proposal for a new one: the Crimson Dragoon. Much more befitting now that the two of you fight alongside dragons, harnessing their strength as your own!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Hahaha... I can see myself warming up to this new name.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The best of luck to you, Orn Khai. I expect you to be as strong as your father the next time our paths do cross. Warrior of Light, I look forward to the day when we are able to fight side by side once more. Keep well.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: He shall have nothing to worry about. I will become just as capable as Father so that I may someday soar the skies with a dragoon like you on my back.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Thank you once again for everything, Forename. It is time for me to begin the journey home with Father and Faunehm, but know that I will ever be in your debt. I sincerely hope this is not the last of our adventures!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the dragoon quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “Courage Born of Fear.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic.
